frameDefinitions: An Agent alters some Material in some useful way by means of some chemical or physical Alterant.
These words refer to separating a Whole into Parts, or separating one part from another.
An Agent causes an Explosive device to explode.
In this frame a Patient is in a phase brought about after a change of phase.
An Exerter, Action, or Force is capable of exerting or does exert a physical force at a level specified by the target.
A Cause or Agent causes a Patient to undergo a change of phase.
frameExamples: Native Americans <t>dyed</t> textiles with dyes made from cedar strips.
I <t>divided</t> the class into groups in alphabetical order .
Collect up the  <t>thawed</t> water from the freezer section.
Eugenie loved the sea and was a <t>strong</t> swimmer.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is a person who applies the Process to the Material.
The <fen>Alterant</fen> causes a change in the <fen>Material</fen>.
The <fen>Material</fen> is altered by the <fen>Agent</fen> in some useful way.
The point in time or period during which the treatment of the <fen>Material</fen> takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Material</fen>s are processed, often a purpose-built facility such as a tannery or water treatment plant.
The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which is separated into <fen>Parts</fen>.  It is usually the NP Object of a target verb.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned. This is most often the Object of a verb.
<fen>Part_2</fen> is the second of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement. First,
With causative uses of these verbs, an Agent separates or divides something.  The Agent is usually expressed as the External Argument:
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-agent that brings about the separation.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> detonates the <fen>Explosive</fen>.
The <fen>Explosive</fen> causes damage to surrounding objects when operated by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> detonates the <fen>Explosive</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> detonates the <fen>Explosive</fen>.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the entity which has had its phase altered.
The <fen>Exerter</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Force</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Action</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
The location where the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to change phase.
The <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes a change of phase brought about by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-<fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the change in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the Time at which the change of phase occurs.
This role identifies the place where change of phase occurs.
listRoleExamples: Stu treated <fex>the lumber</fex> with magical waterproofing fairydust.
The directors split <fex>the company</fex> in two.
The directors split the company <fex>in two</fex>.
First, separate <fex>the yolks</fex> from the whites.
I divided the prize money among the winners <fex>that night</fex>.
You should separate the yolks from the whites <fex>over the sink</fex>.
Salesmen touted the power <fex>of the engine's motor</fex>.
No one should underestimate the mighty <fex>strength</fex> of the dung beetle.
She gave him a playful, weak <fex>punch</fex> in the arm.
My quads feel particularly weak <fex>after 100 squats</fex>.
Muhammad Ali's force <fex>in the ring</fex> was indisputable.
